deck_description: This sure is one of the decks ever made I am not going to give a comprehensive way to play the deck (I am braindead) but there will be a couple notes and questions I feel I may need to answer here 1: We do not play the searchers like wynn the wind channeler or speedroid scratch why is that? you may ask, our opponent has always drawn ash and we would rather have extenders to try and save our play than go -2 2: Wow your ratios of handtraps are weird? you also may ask, yes they are I don't own all the cards I wish and this is my irl deck for locals so go crazy with changing my bad handtraps and such for whatever is needed for your matchups at your own locals and such, same with the sidedeck 3: Primitive butterfly and wandering gryphon rider are interchangable, gryphon rider is however a two card baronne with any level 3 tuner, and we are deathly scared of nibiru, personally I end up using butterfly more just for it's versatility but do whatever makes you comfortable 4: Also ultrahound is an amazing young man please be kind to him, any opener with him is a free dump dupligate into RB shooter, use his power wisely 5: "Sychro summoning this much makes my head hurt" me too buddy, me too

deck_name: Dragon Link Deck Ft. Borrelend Dragon 2022
deck_description:
Replays And Combos:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jL1MmUWiWKw
Synchro Summon dem Monsters

I made this deck for the Xyz Event after I built a pretty cool Utopia deck and was promptly shown the way.

The deck is based off of the Exodia deck that Dzeef has on his channel and an old reversal quiz ftk that I can't find anymore. The goal is to get down to 2000 or 1000 lp through chicken game, map, and popperup, then reversal quiz with set shurikens.

I've tested a few builds and this seems to be the most consistent but you still brick occasionally.

You lose to an ash vs a bad hand, veiler, imperm, and going second vs most decks. You deserve this. Thankfully these aren't really problems in the Xyz Event since everyone is playing self-ftk and numeron otk.

Please don't take this to ranked, just play the Exodia version.

deck_excerpt: This is what Ultimate Defense in Yu-Gi-Oh looks like
deck_description:
The Deck I grinded to Platinum 1 in master duel with. This is a going first deck Key Card Rulings/ Tips: Megalosmasher X
  • Normal summoning can Proc Pacifis
  • cannot benefit from Sea Stealth's 2nd effect to destroy monsters
  • can be searched with fossil dig
Phantasm Spiral Dragon
  • Garnet "Boss" monster
Card of Demise:
  • Can be activated in main Phase 2 after dealing damage to your opponent
  • Can be used to send Pacifis to the grave as a backup for set sea stealth
  • Activation conflicts with pot of extravagance and prosperity but not duality or Pacifis
  • Be careful not to clog up backrow for more draws
Starlight Road:
  • Used to protect backrow from cards like lightning storm or feather duster
  • Be careful summoning Stardust Dragon after negating because it can disrupt phantasm spiral cards which require all monsters to be vanilla
  • cannot stop Evenly matched
Macro Cosmos:
  • Can be used to bait an ash blossom but utterly useless against us
  • be careful with activating cards like phantasm spiral battle or Power after Macro Cosmos because they have a graveyard effect
Pot of Prosperity
  • Can be activated anytime during the main phase unlike pot of Extravagance
  • Use this card to search key cards in deck based on matchup and/or board presence
Vanity's emptiness
  • Cannot be protected from self-destruction using sea stealth attack's 1st effect
Phantasm Spiral Grip
  • Use this card instead of spiral wave to get more damage or summon a Phantasm Spiral Dragon during the Battle Phase to beat over high attack monsters
  • Can bring out Phantasm Spiral Dragon with 3400 attack from hand, deck or graveyard
  • Conflicts with pot of duality and card of demise
Phantasm Spiral Wave
  • Control card which should be used to make your opponent discard a cardÂ of their choice
  • Works well with Macro Cosmos
  • Can be used to bring out Phantasm Spiral Dragon from hand, deck or graveyard
  • Conflicts with pot of duality and card of demise
Phantasm Spiral Battle
  • can be searched by Pacifis
  • can be activated during either's players turn from the hand if Pacifis is out
  • used to disrupt opponent's key plays
  • can be used defensively or offensively to equip all equip cards on the field to 1 monster (most opponents don't read this effect)
Phantasm Spiral Power
  • can be searched by Pacifis
  • can be activated during either's players turn from the hand if Pacifis is out
  • used to disrupt opponent's key plays
  • can be used defensively or offensively to equip 1 equip card from hand or graveyard to 1 monster (most opponents don't read this effect)
Metaverse
  • use this to activate Pacifis from Deck or add to hand (to thin out deck)
Fists of the unrivaled Tenyi
  • Omni-negate for problem cards like evenly-matched or field clears
  • can be used to summon Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon which is a normal monster
Sea Stealth Attack
  • Takes a bit of time to setup as it has to be chained in Master Duel because of the way priority works
  • inactive (useless) without Pacifis
  • can be used to activate Pacifis from Grave or Hand when activated
    • the activated Pacifis will be on a separate chain if chaining Sea Stealth and won't trigger Pacifis
  • can be used to protect all face up spells and traps if banishing a water monster
  • Spiral tokens generated with Pacifis will be able to destroy all other monsters even before battling if sea stealth is "active"
    • attacking with a token with an "active" sea stealth will be considered destroyed by a trap effect
    • if the opponent's monster can't be destroyed by spell or trap effects, the monsters will battle normally and tokens will be susceptible to destruction by battle
    • can be used to banish Megalosmasher X to protect it for a turn especially if spiral token is out as opponent's monsters usually can't kill them by battle
    • Megalosmasher doesn't get the destroy effect of Sea Stealth
  • spiral tokens can used as tribute for 1st effect to protect cards but won't return during end phase as token's cannot be banished
    • if opponent activates a card to destroy face up spells or traps, chain 1st effect to banish a spiral token which will replace itself due to Pacifis
  • Banish monsters or tokens equipped with spell cards to clear up space for backrow
    • equip spells can be re-equipped with phantasm spiral power from graveyard
  • wait for opponent to destroy Pacifis before activating in order to be able to re-activate from the graveyard
Pacifis the Phantasm City
  • "Boss" Field Spell
  • Generates Phantasm Spiral Tokens on opponent's effect activation (2k att, 2k Def, Level 8 Water Wyrm)
    • generates tokens whenever you don't have one (even if you tribute it for another effect or it gets destroyed)
  • Searches Phantasm Spiral cards Once Per Turn on normal monster normal or special summon
  • Protect at all Costs
Best Combos:
  • Pacifis + Sea Stealth: once per turn free protect all face up flood gates while having recurring monsters which can destroy any monster which doesn't have spell/ trap protection
  • Emptiness + Macro Cosmos: no special summons and cards on your field are banished so emptiness doesn't destroy itself.
Extra deck isn't very important. Just fodder for Extravagence. Only cards that matter are Blue eyes Ultimate Dragon For fists of the unrivaled Tenyi, Stardust Dragon for Starlight Road and LANphorhynchus if you need to get rid of a kaiju for a vanilla monster. *Missing extra Deck card is Evolzar Dolkka

deck_name: T.E.T: Timelord Eldlich Train (Timelord's Trip to Eldland)
deck_excerpt: T.E.T (Timelord Eldlich Train), is a surprisingly good deck that you can play at a competitive level
deck_description:
This deck is an optimization of 3 decks : Timelords, Eldlich and Trains that share the affinity that they can easily Xyz 10.

It's surprisingly efficient and you have a lot of plays you can do to better suit the situation on hand, you can OTK with big monsters, Stall and burn with Timelords, pop annoying cards left and right with Eldlich and Derricrane.

This will surprise your opponent never knowing which route you'll take.

deck_excerpt: Fairly cheap XYZ deck using dolls and Princess Cologne.  Not optimized yet.
deck_description:
This deck is based around using Princess Cologne combined with either Grandpa Demetto or Doll House to get XYZ monsters out.

Soul Tiger and Phantom Gryphon could be swapped for other Normal monsters, but you should use level 4 Normal monsters with either 0 Atk or 0 Def.

The 6 Doll Monster cards are required for Doll Happiness to work.

Box of Friends is basically required before you can Princess Cologne on the field in an effective way.Â  This is easiest with Doll Happiness, but setting Box and letting it be destroyed works otherwise.

Grandpa Demetto, if you already have one Normal monster in the GY and Princess Cologne has at least one material, allows you to SS any rank 8 XYZ from the Extra deck, depending on what you need at the time.

Fortune Fairy Hikari is an additional way to get Demetto out.Â  There may be a better replacement that doesn't clog your hand if drawn as a starting card.

Doll House allows you to get out rank 6 XYZs, but with the requirement of having 2 Normal monsters in the GY that also have a copy still in the deck.Â  Use Pot/Jar of Avarice if there are too many in the GY and none in the deck to make this happen.

Nefarious Archfiend Eater of Nefariousness can be special summoned when Grandpa Demetto is on the field, and once it goes to the GY can destroy your other monsters to come back from the GY, proccing Supply Squad, proccing Box of Friends, or just getting rid of a monster you don't need anymore, such as certain XYZ monsters that are out of materials.

Supply Squad and Piercing the Darkness provide additional card draws, and Piercing the Darkness additionally buffs any XYZ monster that used Normal monsters as materials for summoning.Â  Pairs very nicely with Kachi Kochi Dragon.

Solemn and Ash Blossom probably shouldn't need explained.

Number 97: Draglubion could be easily swapped for a different XYZ but I highly recommend the others, especially Hieratic Sun Dragon Overlord of Heliopolis, which combos with Grandpa Demetto (who will usually be on the field if Hieratic is out, since you need Demetto to create the level 8 materials).

This deck has all the cards that he used in Duelist Kingdom But to make a 40 card deck we have add cards we think he would of had. We hope you like it. and don't forget that the ban list doesn't apply.

Check out our YouTube Channel for more. JollieScarecrows
Basic Superheavy deack without Ash Blossom and Joyous Spring

deck_excerpt: My favourite nun? I think I'd have to go with Sister Mary Phoenix Enforcer
deck_description:
Missionary Brief This is a fun, mid-range, rogue deck that pivots between the Exosister Xyz monsters to build advantage and search on your turn and create adaptable and powerful disruption on your opponent's. The DPE package is used to wear down opponents' resources and provide added disruption. Standard turn 1 involves going into one or two Xyz to search for Exosister spell and traps, protected by Lord of the Heavenly Sky Prison.Â  The SistersÂ  The Exosister main deck monsters are devoted to a life of chastity and modesty by which I mean they don't do very much. Bar their quick-Xyz effects they each have either mild swarming abilities or even milder card advantage effects. Elis is by far the most versatile, Sophia is the best to have on board for the free draw and Stella is useful enough, essential three ofs, if just for the names. I'm sure Irene's a lovely gal but her cycle effect is by far the least useful since usually you want to be seeing the Exosister cards in hand, still an important one of for Vadis and Pax. The Exosister extra deck monsters are really where the deck gets to shine providing a wide range of highly useful and relevant effects to stop each of your opponents plays. When Exosister Magnifica arrives with Dimension Force it will be a welcome addition for its high impact and OTK enabling ability. Arment, Pax and Vadis are all fantastic suporting cards to help you build resources on your turn and enable Xyz plays. Carpedivem is a really interesting and versatile support spell that can be used to play around cards like Ash and Nibiru but also turn off floodgates like Skill Drain and Mystic Mine. Rank 4 Extenders I've come to learn that rank 4 extenders in Yugioh are pretty much a game of pick your poison. Dynatherium is close enough the only completely "free" extender for the deck providing at worst a free body and at best providing some quick xyz upgrades for your nuns to punish any opponents on the side of the player base that don't value reading. The deck is built with as few bricks as possible to try and offset the fact the deck struggles to built up card advantage on turn one. The risk of opening double Parallel eXceed however is easily offset by the amount of advantage it can get you (extending from the deck is really good, who knew?!) All your sisters are potencial Almiraj material to get into eXceed plays and even if it gets ashed, you're left with all you need to Anaconda into DPE on exactly your 5th summon. Shade Brigandine is always live turn one and that's when you'll need it most. Even if you have to set it, it at least often has LOTHP protection.Â  Friends of the Convent Lord Of The Heavenly Prison really is an MVP of the deck. He lets you set multiple backrow turn 1 without worrying about falling foul of a feather duster and allows you to search powerful follow traps for your next, often Vadis or Judgment. He's easily searchable by Gallant Granite who can then be used to make Utopic Draco Future with one of your Sisters or linked off for Anaconda. Called by the Grave and Triple Tac help you play through hand traps and Xyz Reborn gives some recovery otherwise lacking from the deck. Triple Imperm because it's great going first or second and IMO the best hand trap in the game at the moment. F0 and Zeus because they're F0 and Zeus and Gagaga Magician to help facilitate some F0 plays. STRENGTHS
  • It's fun, unique and like any decent rogue option puts an opponent who doesn't know how it plays on the back foot.
  • In the right hands it is incredibly versatile and able to adjust and target disruption on the fly.
  • Good, new support on its way.
  • While it doesn't synergise enough to warrant playing, its generally quite comfortable playing through banish cards like Macro Cosmos
WEAKNESSES + PROBLEM CARDS
  • It's a difficult deck to play. While the cards for the most part function pretty simply there's very few easy wins with this one, one wrong move can lose you a game. Knowing how your opponent's deck and cards work is vitally important in order to target your disruption.
  • The recovery for the deck is really low. If you burn through all your main or extra deck Exosisters you'll be lying high and dry.
  • Going second
  • It's expensive. These days you can build some pretty meta-competant decks on a budget, this is neither.
  • Ash Blossom, Nibiru, There Can Be Only One and Cosmic Cyclone all have the potencial to throw your game plan off big time. Unless you side in Ice Dragon's Prison, it really struggles to get over Dragoon too.
  Constructive feedback and good side deck options always appreciated!

deck_excerpt: FTK your opponent with lapis lazuli's burn damage!
deck_description:
Siphon through your deck until you get black garden on the field, brilliant fusion summon Lapis Lazuli, and Cyber-Stien to special summon Master Diamond. From there, activate Lapis's effect and then copy it with Master Diamond for the FTK.

You need to have black garden on the field before the 2 gem knights or else there wont be enough tokens for the FTK

The ol' Isolde into Armageddon Knight looping... but with the Adventurer engine.

The deck aims to end on Adventurer Token, Wandering Gryphon Rider, Dawn Dragster, Apollousa and Phoenix Enforcer with set Fogblade. Alternatively, you could make Abyss Dweller or Masq in place of Verte into DPE at end. Full board needs Rite of Aramesir and two warriors for Isolde.
Casual Magnet Warriors, budget

I like playing Paleofrogs. It's a trap-based strategy that functionally turns into a combo-deck by the end of turn 4. But time has not been kind to the archetype. Control decks like Eldlich and Dogmatika simply outpace it in a few key areas. Recoverability, pressure, compactness, there are a lot of reasons the deck can't stand up to its modern counterparts.

However, for a brief stint, I found the deck rather playable. The frog engine pairs very well with the Numeron engine. Numeron gives frogs a first turn Apollousa or Avramax to pair with your traps. It can also provide an OTK to unsuspecting opponents. Swap Frog's bounce for cost effect lets you clear the field of your normal summon, meaning you can dump a Ronintoadin and resolve a Numeron Network on the same turn. Pair that with arguably the best boss monster in Yu-Gi-Oh, the aptly named Toadally Awesome, and you have a pretty solid deck.

With ZEXAL's ban, I have had to make a few updates, but I am overall still pleased with the deck.

deck_excerpt: The Fusion monster makes the archetype faster and more consistent. With huge OTK pottentials.
deck_description:
You always want to get your fusion monster out turn 1, then use its effects to establish a board.

If you open with the Fusion spell, use it. If you dont, normall summon Genni or Schmietta > use its effect to get the other one> get Potterie. Activate in Schmietta graveyard, sending the fusion spell, then Genni to copy it and fusion summon. Worst case if you have none, you will have to normal summon Potterie or use Creation.

try for lethal when you feel it is safe. Collaboration give double attack to the witches and you have option to link climb into Code talker.

Card choices:
-standard Witchcrafters.

-third Genne as how impotant she is to fusion summon

-3 Fusion spells, getting it in open hand is so rewarding it is worth even if you never use 3.

-1 Edel good target for Vicemaster special summon, you never want to draw her. replaceable

-1 Magicians soul, 1 masterpieceÂ  to link climb into charmer -> selene> codeTalker.

-2nd Bystreet, 2nd draping,Â  : as the deck gets more combo oriented, protection and trap removal get more valuable.

-veiler: hand trap that is spellcaster.

- patronus: testing, may replace it.

-other hand traps: preferences

deck_excerpt: Psst! Hey kid... I hear you like drawing cards....
deck_description:
If you want to spam, you have come to the right place.

Karakuri recieved some new support some time ago, and I wanted to play it. But it bricked; it bricked hard. Its lines were short, except that occasional golden opportunity that would dump your entire extra deck onto the field, half your deck into your GY, and the other half into your hand. Why yes, every synchro is a Halqifibrax, but what good is that if you can't make them?

And now, we have received a gift, the extenders we not only needed, but deserved: Ready Fusion and Emergency Teleport (to 3).

These two cards solve most problems, offering a variety of ways to manipulate the levels of monsters available to unlock even the rustiest of hands.

deck_name: Dark Magician Deck for Master Duel

deck_excerpt:
Visit DarkArmedDuelist YouTube channel to see the deck list:
here is the link to the video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuQVObU1Og
deck_description:
Write your deck strategy here...

Have fun fusion any of the boss monster from this deck. VisitÂ DarkArmedDuelist YouTube channel to see the deck list: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuQVObU1Og

Upon losing Block Dragon, Adamancipator fell off the map. Other combo decks could do what it did, but better: Infernoble, Drytron, Dragonlink, Virtual World. They were more consistent, not requiring the bricky rocks that built the bulk of your deck should you want to build large combo boards.

However, Adamancipator has an unexplored, and exceptionally powerful synchro: Adamancipator Risen - Leonite. This monster allows you to excavate 5 and add any Adamancipator card (monster, spell, or trap) to your hand, and, if you can get a fire into the GY, can revive a monster on your opponent's turn. Koa'ki Meiru Guardian is the obvious choice, but less obvious option is Adamancipator Crystal - Dragite, who will trigger and let you draw a card.

Add in that their field spell, Adamancipator Laputite, can stack your deck once per turn, and you can fate-seal yourself into two starters and a guaranteed excavation on your following turn, making this strategy incredibly sticky.

This deck is streamlined to do one thing: make Halq and a live Leonite, and start plusing. Handtraps form the backbone of your interactions, and we play a whopping 11 of them. Including the three Forbidden Droplets, and you have a robust package to give you a chance when going second.

If you're tired of being blown out by Dark Ruler no More, and still want to play rocks, this may be right up your alley.
Dark magician

To be viable en masse, the Ogdoadics need to resolve one glaring issue: Alleirt's recursion of non-HOPT handtraps to the opponent's hand (think veiler). Therefore, another method of preventing the banishment of Nunu and Nauya is required. Using them as XYZ material bypasses that restriction. In comes the time thieves to fill out the remainder of this strategy. Incidental synergy with extenders such as stardust trail, protection via gamma for both your big starters (snake rain and regulator), and follow-up with a searched water lily leading to a Ogdoabyss creates a casual rank-4 strategy.

Your combos can easily access Time Thief Redoer and Retrograde to enable searches of Gamma off of a Lambda. Spicier plays setup a Crossrose Dragon and a Rikka Queen Strenna. The Crossrose can tribute the Strenna, netting a bounce or field wipe and a Hyperyton monster negate.

deck_name: Golden Lord Of The Skull Servants ;)
deck_excerpt: A combination of King of the Skull Servants and Endlich to create a graveyard heavy zombie deck!
deck_description:
just put the entire fucking deck into the graveyard then gg.

But seriously this works better than it should. I know I could have cheesed with a LOT more annoying trap cards, but I've been using this in Mater duel against some friends and it's the perfect balance between shitass annoying and creative.

Anyway, quick strategy description; You want wightprince in the graveyard by any means. The most basic way of doing this is playing wightprincess and using her effect. Uni zombie also helps by discarding Wightbaking, which allows you to add wightprince and then discard him. Uni zombie ties both archetypes extremely well tbh since he can send Eldlich and any skull servant/ wight card to the graveyard pretty easily.Â  Anyway, you eventually use wightprince in the GY to special summon King of the skull servants and just deal a fuckton of damage.

THERE ARE REALLY EASY WAYS TO BACKFIRE. Wightprincess's 2nd effect should generally be used BEFORE you summon Eldlich otherwise you drown your attack points for no benefit.Â  Also, skill drain does kill King of the Skull Servants' effect so really only use it to stall while you have a Eldlich in your GY so you can get rid of skill drain manually.

Burial from a different dimension is the only thing saving yourself from getting locked when your opponent banishes your monsters, you can play around with the ratios but keeping it at 2 is safe enough for me.

The things this deck can do is insanely fun. There's a lot of cheese you can do to save yourself in the extra deck, especially if you a super unlucky hand of 3 regular skull servants and two wight princes, you can link summon and send them to the graveyard and unbrick yourself. Knightmare works really well for this.

This deck just has so many basic things going for it that's easy to understand and hard to mess up WHILE still having the adjustability of any viable deck.

You have a deck that's really hard to brick yourself, A ton of sustain through your trap cards, ways to thin out your deck to your benefit, and cards with really high attack potential (king of the skull servant).

deck_excerpt: ABC mixed with Clear New World in order to bring out synchros.
deck_description:
This is all based around a brand new card available at common, Clear New World.

Clear New World is situated perfectly for ABC due to the fact destroying your own A,B, or C just plusses you, and with tuner access now allows you to make Baronne along with your normal end board.

The idea is to use the Clear New World with 2 or more ABC monsters on field to grab an Ash Blossom, make Burei to grab Ninishi, then make Baronne.

The side board shows some of my side board and other ideas, like just making Dawn Dragster, or for a budget option using Burei to grab Gama to make Crystal Wing.

I think the general idea of Clear New World is one that needs to be explored more and has a ton of potential.

deck_excerpt: A Chaos MAX Dragon Focused deck that utilizes Impcantation cards to consistently get OTKS or just overpower opponents.
deck_description:
Honestly the extra deck is unfinished, but you won't get too many opportunities to access them anyway because Impcantation locks you out of it. there are plenty of ways to clear your own Impcantation cards like having a bewd in hand and tributing but the goal is chaos dragons regardless. Crealtar also helps with giving your impcantation cards some damage if you didn't summon them in defense AND unlocks your extra deck by negating the impcantation cards but not the ritual ones.

I would say the 5 most replaceable cards in this deck would probably have to be Raigeki, Harpie's, Solemn, Skill drain, and Return of the Dragon lords. They're really only there because of my experience with specific players, I encourage you to swap these out with stuff that suits your playstyle and or builds upon the chaos archetype.

Biggest weakness would definitely have to be the inability to clear the board or negate stuff in general, I used to have ash blossom but I think I can get away with skill drain more with more effect. I found that with most problematic cards, regular chaos dragon would just flip it and the problem was solved.

I see too many chaos max dragon profiles exclude Blue-Eyes Chaos Dragon (the 3000 one) and I don't get why, its so easy to summon both and guarantee you OTK on 2nd turn if the opponent can't negate you and they have at minimum 2 monsters on the field.

First deck! ...There's not much to it, I think.

There's a few routes it could take. First step is to deal direct spell damage/healing wherever possible. Then it branches:

(1) Sack a bunch of monsters to beef up the Shadow Ghoul (Unhappy Maiden. etc.), which pairs well with the Castle of Dark Illusions/Pumpking combo (the zombie deck that could've been :< ).

(2) Get the Battleguard squad growing (using Sangan and Black Forest Witch to get them to your hand if needed). If you can get the Sogen field out there, all the better.

(3) There's also a few defensive/direct damage options (Catapult Turtle, Cannon Soldier, Suijin to some extent). Pair Suijin with Ring of Magnetism for... something, idk.

Sorry for the lack of trap cards, I didn't draft any good ones :/

deck_excerpt: Yes Libromancer can apparently do more than just Tzolkin Control
deck_description: Just wanna let you know that I and many others want an anthology series of Libromancer support that is playable enough for us to at least let us get as creative and zany as we can be. So in spite of all the constant barrage of ideas of decks for this archetypes, Phantom Knights can indeed run this engine. While not the best in the world, it doesn't take much for it to get what it needs done for the sake of self doubt. In short, just play Phantom Knights how it should be played However the only problem I haven't added for the sake of this being a demonstration deck is the addition of Crossout Designator targets. Other than than, the notion of adding the Libromancer engine is to extend the link plays (if taking the Agent/Doombroker route) or going the XYZ route excluding Raider's Knight (if taking the Geek-Boy/ Firestarter Route). Destroy Phoenix Enforcer also helps in a time of need for he does things (especially Celestial for Draw 2 and Dasher for Special Summoning if you draw into a monster during the draw phase, while in the GY). As for Raider's Knight, he is there for Arc Rebellion XYZ Dragon (indestructible beefcake that could DRNM all monsters on the field the turn it used it's XYZ effect).

deck_excerpt: "Eldlich is the best back row stun deck in the current meta" LMAO
deck_description: Hi, Grayewick the Fusionist here, back with an actual Fusion strategy again in a long time this time, one that is not necessarily not a top tier deck itself but can definitely kill most top tier decks, especially Eldlich and Drytron, Gravekeeper's Dogmatika. As per usual, cards on the main will be my personal choices based on what cards I currently have, and the cards on the side will be the tech options for you to consider. A few questions: â¢ "Why Dogmatika? That seems counter intuitive since they're all about the GY set up?" - This deck doesn't really care about how fast it wants to win. All it needs is to control the tempo of the game within its reach and be comfortable with that pace. If you can manage to keep that, everything else will follow. But I do admit that often times I find myself lacking necessary pressure, and the Dogmatika cards are just generally great as a supplementary engine for anything that needs that but isn't really concerned about sacrificing their Special Summons from the Extra Deck. I also did some tests with the Shaddoll Schism, and it could be fine, I guess? But for you to be able to access that, you'd need to turn your Necrovalley off first, which isn't good so I've cut it. But what I did consider is putting x3 El Shaddoll Apkallones in the Extra Deck as Dogmatika Punishment targets and including one copy of each Naelshaddoll Ariel, Shaddoll Dragon, and Shaddoll Beast for added utility. The game plan, and the list: It's pretty simple. â¢ x3 Necrovalley - Your boss card, not even a monster, which deals with the GY. If this card properly resolves, you pretty much win the game against most decks. I do not recall any top tier deck that doesn't make great use of the graveyard as of now, but I am damn sure they all do. â¢ x3 Royal Tribute - This card is what truly seals the deal, since it deals with the hand. There's a reason why Confiscation, Delinquent Duo, and The Forceful Sentry are all banned. If I could make a room for Monarchs, I'd even put Thestalos the Mega Monarch in here, but maybe that's a list for another day to test. Phantom Knights need to banish themselves to gain effects from the GY. Drytrons activate from the GY, but tributes for cost and cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Eldlich also activates from the GY and also sends for cost. It doesn't matter. â¢ x1 Dogmatika Maximus - The one card dedicated to deal with the Extra Deck. This is probably the only list of Dogmatika that I'll use Maximus with, at least as of now, because this list isn't really concerned too much with being able to summon Extra Deck monsters. â¢ x3 Skill Drain, Royal Decree, Jinzo - Any of these three will do, but personally I would choose Skill Drain to deal with on field monster effects. I just want that extra consistency that Pot of Prosperity provides. The latter two for trap heavy floodgates even though we do not really care about that, except probably for There Can Be Only One., also it turns off our Dogmatika Punishments and Solemn Judgments, which is bad because we need protection for Lightning Storm. â¢ x2 Gravekeeper's Supernaturalist - This card is more of a win more card, which also provides itself and your Necrovalley some neat destruction protection. He's a decent beat stick, and he also searches your Hidden Temples of the Necrovalley, which also is in here to deal with Special Summons in general. â¢ x3 Imperial Tombs of Necrovalley - It's an archetypal Infernity Barrier, despite it being a hard once per turn, it's still good to have as an added protection to be considered, although it's an SR so if you're on a budget, I don't really recommend it. Despite winning most of the time without actually needing to Fusion Summon, this still technically is a Fusion strategy so I figured I might want to share it because I love Fusion strategies in general (with a select few exceptions). So yeah, enjoy ruining Eldlich and Drytron players' lists.

deck_excerpt: P.U.N.K. synchro deck with the Adventurer engine and Halqifibrax lines.
deck_description:
This deck is a little messy, so any comments or assistance would be appreciated. This deck seeks to set up a board of negates with Borreload Savage Dragon, Joruri-P.U.N.K. Nashiwari Surprise/Joruri-P.U.N.K. Dangerous Gabu, and a synchro summon on the opponent's turn into Ukiyoe P.U.N.K. Amazing Dragon.

 

How does this deck work? Well, the Adventurer Engine and Halqifibrax lines are both self explanatory, but there are some interactions that I want to point out. When using Rite of Aramesir, it locks you out of activating the abilities of normal summoned monsters for the rest of the turn. Most P.U.N.K.s have an ability you will most definitely want to use on their summon, so consider special summoning the ones you want to activate. A few ways to do this:

-Emergency Teleport, search and summon a P.U.N.K. (Ze Amin if you need monsters, Sharakusai if you have the other P.U.N.K. in hand to fusion summon with, or Wagon/Madame Spider depending if you need Spells or Traps)

-Noh-P.U.N.K. Foxy Tune can discard themselves and one card from hand to special a P.U.N.K. from deck

-Noh-P.U.N.K. Dia Note can send themselves from hand to grave to special a P.U.N.K. from hand

-When Noh-P.U.N.K. Dia Note is sent to the grave, you can special a P.U.N.K. from grave

-Lastly,Â  you can tribute the P.U.N.K. fusion monster (Carp Rising) to special two P.U.N.K.s from deck

 

Keep these in mind, because we almost always want to activate Rite of Aramesir and set up the Wandering Gryphon Rider as a negate. On most of our starting turns, whether we go first or second, we want to move through the Halq line to get to Borreload Savage Dragon. That isn't hard for this deck; the tricky part is figuring out what we make alongside it.

 

For now, I'm uploading a list in progress. I'm going to update this description and decklist over time, and any suggestions or comments you have I'm happy to incorporate. Thanks for taking the time to read this!

deck_excerpt: Kozmo Deck specifically designed for XYZ fest. Goes into Rank 3 or Rank 5 cards to assist with extensions and disruptions
deck_description:
Kozmo for the Master Duel XYZ Fest event.

Kozmo already works really well in MDÂ  since they really don't need to dig into the extra deck to kill, they do have lots of good options with a proper rank 5 engine, though. The XYZ Fest banlist hit a lot of popular decks with non-targeting destruction, making it easier to just throw down a destroy mid-combo on your opponent and watching them struggle to get over it.... just always make sure you SS into defense mode against Utopia if you don't want to eat a game-ending swing.

Galaxy Soldier can overlay with Sliperider to go into Nova and then Infinity for an omni-negate.

Soartroopers can grab another copy of themselves or Farmgirl from grave to overlay into either a Leviair or Nightmare Shark, the latter of which can go into Zeus.

use the cardian engine to search out world legacy awakening while filling the board with lightflare ect. link in opp turn to either i:p then link to either goddess monster.

extend turn 2 with super koi koi or super all in and link into verte to summon dpe.

Hi, it's been a while. Grayewick the Fusionist here, I took a bit of a break from Master Duel and dueling in general, to an extent, just to get myself cleaned off of the tilt and salt that's been building up within me due to the terrible format that is the OCG but hey, I'm back with a deck that I've been using in the Xyz Festival right now, pure Mekk-Knights. As per usual, the cards in the side would be the "nice to haves" or the tech choices I personally would use. "Why play this over Scars turbo?" Well first of all, Girsu, the Orcust Mekk-Knight is at 1 (for some reason), so it's not gonna be as consistent, and second is I do not have the other cards to make it work and I can't fill any good fillers for the strategy because a lot has to go right to pull it off. The Strategy: So, as per usual, the strategy is simple. You build a standard Mekk-Knight list, you stun them with World Legacy's Secrets, World Legacy Whispers, and World Legacy Key, and you beat them down with your Mekk-Knights since they're all just bigger Cyber Dragons. A lot of decks in the event right now are anti-meta Barrier Statue stun or Phantasm Spirals, and this is where this deck shines. ALSO, thank God and everything in creation that Eldlich the Golden Lord is banned, I am so sick and tired of seeing that monki flip deck (even though to a small extent I am partially responsible for it because I've shared some of my list about it but I digress), it's just a deck that could be argued as "maybe fun" to use, but definitely not fun to play against. Discussing the list changes: The only difference between this deck and the usual Mekk-Knight build is that we don't have access to Mekk-Knight of the Morning Star, Lib the World Key Blademaster, or Mekk-Knight Crusadia Avramax, which makes the zone management a bit more challenging. But the good thing is, since it's an Xyz centered event, a lot of decks are playing the nasty floodgates such as Imperial Order or Skill Drain, both of which we can comfortably play around and through since we play a lot of high-impact going second cards. â¢ x3 Mekk-Knight Avram - Since we also do not have access to the Invoked package, our dedicated Normal Summon will be filled by him. He's a 2000 ATK Normal Monster, which means he can get over the Barrier Statues or Banisher of the Radiance/Banisher of the Light. If you wanna go really budget, that's also fantastic since you can turbo him out of the deck with the freely obtainable Unexpected Dais, but the most important thing is he's a Mekk-Knight, which means your Continuous Spells/Traps work with him. â¢ x1 Mekk-Knight Orange Sunset - This card is usually not being played in most, if not all, Mekk-Knight lists, but since we have space, we could play it just for the name, and it's a 3000 DEF wall. It's effect to Special Summon from the hand doesn't always come up, but it's always nice to have than nothing (I think). â¢ x3 Lightning Storm, Evenly Matched, Forbidden Droplet, Ice Dragon's Prison - The remaining 9 slots of your deck could be any combination of these four cards. I only chose Lightning Storm, Evenly Matched, and Ice Dragon's Prison because it deals better with the anti-meta stuff than Forbidden Droplet, even though clearing our opponent's board seems counter intuitive. â¢ x3 World Legacy's Memory - In pure Mekk-Knight variants, this deck is usually just played as either a 1 or 2 of since it's searchable, but since we do not have access to Lib the World Key Blademaster, it's safe to play it to 3, plus, it's an archetypal Emergency Teleport. â¢ Extra Deck - These are just filler cards. If you have Number 38: Hope Harbinger Dragon Titanic Galaxy, or both Number 97: Draglubion and Number 100: Numeron Dragon, or any generic Rank 8 monsters that are generally good, play them. So yeah, that's pretty much it. There's really nothing much else to discuss about this deck but have fun, I guess. Until next time.

deck_excerpt: Sky Striker and Exosisters Joins forces.
deck_description:
Start of with they sky striker engine.

then follow up with the exosister engine.

the exosisters can xyz with one material which protects themselves from card effects or by battle from monsters form the graveyard.

 

normal raye or roze for the sky strikers then link into hayate if going second or shizuku if going first. shizuku search engage if going first and you don't open it but if you do open engage and your going first play engage and then search widow anchor (1st negate of the turn) normal raye/roze or play hornet drones (if you open it) then link into kagari add bac the engage to search eagle booster and set it (protection). add a second widow anchor of shizuku,

 

for the exosister normal stella and if you have pax search either vadis or elis.

the deck can make accesscode talker turn one if you open engage, pax and instant fusion.

if you open engage and rax play engage chain pax search vadis of pax then of engage search hornet drones. set vadis and activate drones. link one into kagari add engage. activate engage to search widow anchor then set it. activate instant fusion to special summon allvain. link two into halqifibrax spec effect veiler. link 3 into selene then spec back effect veiler, link 4 into accesscode talker.

if your halqifibarax gets negated you can still play accesscode but it does take a bit longer but you can get a raye in the grave in your opponents turn with riser dragon. just because halq got negated you can still get selene out if you wait till your turn to use vadis.

when you need to side cards and your playing against a trap heavy deck take out breaktrough skill for royal decree.

sky striker used to get stopped by secret village without summoning effect veiler or selene but now with the exosisters you can play extremely well. it has been testeed against evil twin and it works really well.

deck_excerpt: Koa'ki Meiru are starting to creep up on the meta.  Here's how to win in 1 turn with them.
deck_description: You need Urnight, Iron Core, a level 4 monster in hand OR any monster in the graveyard (to not use Bujinki Ahashima).Â  Or Summoner Monk, any spell card, Iron Core, a level 4 monster in hand OR any monster in the graveyard. Simplest combo: Normal summon Urnight, Urnight reveals Iron Core, special summon Supplier, Supplier searches for Maximus, Link Bujinki Ahashima, Bujinki makes Number 60, Number 60 summons Urnight, Urnight summons Guardian or Supplier, XYZ Dark Rebellion, Vespenate on top of Number 60, summon Maximus, activate Dark Rebellion, destroy a card with Maximus, attack for game. It may sound like a lot of setup at first but it's incredibly consistent to pull off.Â  Summoner Monk works as a second Urnight and only needs 1 extra spell card for the same combo to happen just in a different order, plus he can leave you with Guardian on the field as well to negate a monster effect (Nibiru?).Â  Tin Goldfish makes use of Supplier to search for the missing piece for when you happen to draw into both or even 3 Supplier.Â  Small World can set you up into ANY of these hands.Â  Kaijus are there to get rid of omni-negates, Pankratops puts a monster in the grave (no longer need for Bujinki Ahashima) and gets rid of a card + is also bait, and Adventurer Token engine is there to create an omni-negate before you start your combo. That's it really.Â  The fact that you only need 2 or 3 cards (at worst) means you can also run all these other defensive options to make sure your combo goes through. You could also run Ash Blossom, Crossout Designator, Instant Fusion, Millennium Eyes Restrict, Mudragon of the Swamp, and Cross Sheep for more protection + a different setup similar to Bujinki Ahashima using Cross Sheep and Instant Fusion.

deck_excerpt: Fun Combos, big interesting monsters. Will struggle against Turn 1 hand traps.
deck_description:
A Synchron deck I put together. I've been playing Master Duel a lot recently and wanted to make a TCG version of the deck. It does suck Jet Synchron is banned because it enables a lot of summons for the Synchro Tuners but Doppel Warrior with Brotaur should suffice enough.

You could change up the Side Deck a bit. I put general cards that could be used depending on what your opponent plays. I'm n0t great at side decking so it might not make much sense for what I have there.
